title: Iterative Instance-Based Remote Education Course Design and Operation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and intermediate competency in specialized fields (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: Customized scheduling for learners and flexible learning support in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to distinguish abstract structures from concrete implementation instances in distance education courses.
Learners can apply the process of designing reusable modular instructional materials.
Learners can adjust individualized learning paths by analyzing formative assessment results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
